i2c
Class U2CWrapper

java.lang.Object
  i2c.U2CWrapper
public class U2CWrapper
extends java.lang.Object

Main class for communication with U2C-Devices. The Java Native Interface is used to communicate with the wrapper library.

getSerialNum

public static long getSerialNum(U2CDevice device)
                         throws U2CDeviceException
Retrieves the Serial Number of the current device. This is unique Serial Number. It can be used to identify device when you are using a number of U2C-12 devices simultaneously.

Parameters:
device - U2C-12 device that will be checked.
Returns:
Serial Number.
Throws:
U2CDeviceException

setI2cFreq

public static void setI2cFreq(U2CDevice device,
                              int frequency)
                       throws U2CDeviceException
Configures I2C bus frequency.

Parameters:
device - U2C-12 device to configure.
frequency - The frequency of I2C bus, where:
0 corresponds to I2C bus fast mode (400 kHz).
1 corresponds to I2C bus standard mode (100 kHz).
1+n corresponds to clock period of I2C bus equal to 10 + 2*n uS.
For convenience following constants were introduced:
U2C_I2C_FREQ_FAST I2C bus fast mode (400 kHz)
U2C_I2C_FREQ_STD I2C bus standard mode (100 kHz)
U2C_I2C_FREQ_83KHZ 83 kHz
U2C_I2C_FREQ_71KHZ 71 kHz
U2C_I2C_FREQ_62KHZ 62 kHz
U2C_I2C_FREQ_50KHZ 50 kHz
U2C_I2C_FREQ_25KHZ 25 kHz
U2C_I2C_FREQ_10KHZ 10 kHz
U2C_I2C_FREQ_5KHZ 5 kHz
U2C_I2C_FREQ_2KHZ 2 kHz
Throws:
U2CDeviceException

getI2cFreq

public static int getI2cFreq(U2CDevice device)
                      throws U2CDeviceException
Obtains I2C bus frequency.

Parameters:
device - U2C-12 device to obtain the I2C bus frequency.
Returns:
I2C bus frequency. See setI2cFreq(U2CDevice device, int frequency)
Throws:
U2CDeviceException

setClockSynch

public static void setClockSynch(U2CDevice device,
                                 boolean enable)
                          throws U2CDeviceException
Enables I2C bus clock synchronization.
Clock synchronization (clock stretching) is used in situations where an I2C slave is not able to co-operate with the clock speed provided by the U2C-12 I2C master and needs to slow down an I2C bus. I2C slave holds down the SCL line low and in this way signals the I2C master about a wait state. If I2C bus clock synchronization is enabled, U2C-12 device will wait until I2C slave device releases the SCL line.
Warning: I2C bus clock synchronization (clock stretching) is implemented for I2C bus frequences up to 100kHz. See U2C_SetI2cFreq() to learn how to change I2C bus frequency.

Parameters:
device - U2C-12 device.
enable - Boolean whether clock stretching should be enabled.
Throws:
U2CDeviceException

getClockSynch

public static boolean getClockSynch(U2CDevice device)
                             throws U2CDeviceException
Checks if the I2C bus clock synchronization is enabled.
See setClockSynch(U2CDevice device, boolean enable) for more details

Parameters:
device - U2C-12 device.
Returns:
enable Boolean whether clock stretching is enabled.
Throws:
U2CDeviceException
